abstract: Bloomberg administration is set to commit $2.4 billion in public and private investment to applying new environmental technology to old problem of flow of untreated sewage and storm water into New York City’s waterways.
snippet: New York City has a tentative approval from the state on a plan to introduce technologies that are expected to greatly reduce sewer overflow into area waterways.
lead_paragraph: New York City has a tentative approval from the state on a plan to introduce technologies that are expected to greatly reduce sewer overflow into area waterways.

headline.main: New Tactics and Billions to Manage City Sewage
headline.print_headline: New Tactics And Billions To Manage City Sewage
headline.seo: New York City Set to Commit $2.4 Billion on Storm Water-Control Tactics
